datoCmsKey.name: Salem Corwin

headshot.title: Salem Corwin, headshot via Editor, 6:01:53 AM 10/18/2020

datoCmsKey.danceExperience: MODERN/STEP/JAZZ - SUNY Buffalo State (2014-2018) - TAP/JAZZ/BALLET - NYCA Conservatory (2006-2013)
datoCmsKey.bio:
Salem Corwin (He/They) is an actor, songwriter, and radio host from the Hudson Valley. 
Much of his work is driven by the beliefs that human connection is magical, and that telling our stories will ultimately change the world. Salem is most recognized for their performances at The Duplex (NYC) with the infamous "Trans Voices Cabaret", and for their role in the 2017 short film, "Pluck" (by Mandy Hebblethwaite). This year Salem released his second self-produced album, titled "messy" (2020). 
Beyond his acting career Salem is a proud plant dad, an avid knitter, a Jewitch (Jewish witch), and a raging scorpio.
